one_reviews_text: Not much happening, but just a nice few minutes

The visuals for this are delightful and the song is pleasing. It has the feel of a Fable style game that I would love to see more of. However, it is just over 2 minutes, the length of the song ‘Dream nº1’, and an advertisement for the full album on 5 different services that will open in tabs in your web browser. I would love to see something like the entire album as a VR visual experience though.

review_title: great way of advertising your music
one_reviews_text: Relaxing music and the animations were nice =)
Awesome music and beautiful landscape!

review_title: I do love this but it is short.  would
one_reviews_text: like to go down the path under the bridge.  Also would like to see more like this. The a button does not work for me.
review_feedback: Hi! Thank you very much for the feedback. I just update the app and I've fixed A button issue with touch controllers. "Dreams" are short piano themes and maybe someday I'll publish all my themes in VR, but for the moment "Dream nº1" is the only one in VR. Thank you very much for watching and greetings!

one_reviews_text:
I downloaded this a year ago & I still take a look occasionally. It's very well done & the music is lovely. My only complaint is that it's too short.
Any sign of No 2 yet?  I want more :)
Looking out for No 2, thanks !
a beautiful fairtale landscape, very nice, please more!
waste of time
The visuals are rather beautiful but there is not all that much going on in this short experience.
Beautiful, too short...

I downloaded this when it first came out and I still dip in every few weeks or months for a couple of minutes.  I like the music.  I gave this 5 stars originally, thinking the dev had created/drawn all the visuals, until I realised they were from a library.  However, this is still nicely put together, and the piano track is original and really good.  I still enjoy the experience every so often.
Cute, but short
It's only a small video but it's a nice tour of someones virtual scene.
Short video but very well made.

review_title: Very short but worth the ride
one_reviews_text: Not something that you would watch more than once or twice, but well executed. I would have preferred not having that cursor move everywhere you move your head. It's distracting. Also, a little more life in the village would have been nice. The piano was beautiful and it's free which is why I'm not rating this lower. If it had cost anything, I would have given it 2 stars.
Good music and good experience.

Cool, short experience, but there is no story or narrative. The piano music was beautiful and complimented the scene nicely. The butterfuly cursor that follows your gaze unfortunately distracts from the beautiful environment. Worth a download nonetheless.
Enjoyable, but as another reviewer noted, that cursor (and the butterfly) are really annoying. Could you add a setting to disable them?
Can't complain. It is a free, nice and beautiful animation through a fairytale miniature village. Reminds me of a nice place in a fantasy MMORPG I played some time ago.
Beautiful piano playing and scenery will make you feel your'e on a Disney ride.
Nice short experience, but it nails the presentation.  Since it's on-rails, you can't do much, but the music is good.  I can't wait to see more.

Not sure what the point behind this is, but it was pretty dull and boring. Lasts like 3 minutes where you just hover along the ground and watch some houses, trees, water and a butterfly. Watch once, delete.
It's a good demonstration of what VR can do, but as a stand-alone product it's way too short and way too limited. Worth watching once though.
Nice boobs, but short experience.
Nice experience and good music! Would like to explore the little village further.
wonderful
